That sounds like a great plan! Introducing Ticket to Ride as the main event for your next game night will surely be a hit with your group. The game's unique blend of strategy, geography, and train-themed fun will provide a nice change of pace from the party games like Codenames and Pictionary.

As the host, you can take the opportunity to create a themed evening around Ticket to Ride. You could decorate the space with train-related items, serve snacks and drinks inspired by the game's North American routes, or even have a small "train station" setup with props and costumes.

Since your group has a good mix of gamers, Ticket to Ride's accessibility will ensure that everyone can participate and have fun. The game's 30-60 minute playtime is also a great fit for a game night, allowing you to play a few rounds or try out different strategies.

As a host, you might also consider preparing some tips and strategies to share with your group before the game starts. This can help new players understand the game's mechanics and objectives, and give more experienced players some ideas to improve their gameplay.

Remember to have fun and be flexible! Game nights are all about enjoying good company, good food, and good games. Don't hesitate to adapt the evening to your group's preferences and energy levels.

Are there any specific aspects of Ticket to Ride that you're looking forward to sharing with your group, or any particular strategies you're excited to try out?
